oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Electrochemistry in leaching of sulphides
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VENKATACHALAM, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: anodic-dissolution
hydrochloric-acid
lead sulfide
galvanic interaction
metal sulfides
chalcopyrite
behavior
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In recent years, there has been an increasing interest in studying the electrochemical properties of metal sulphides particularly with respect to hydrometallurgical processing of the sulphides. Electrochemical reactions have been shown to play an important role in the aqueous oxidation and dissolution of metal sulphides. Galvanic interactions between mixed sulphide mineral systems have received considerable attention. Studies on the direct electrolysis of metal sulphides and sulphide concentrates have generated a large amount of data. A knowledge of the electrode potentials of sulphides, their polarisation behaviour and galvanic interactions between mixed sulphides as a function of pH and oxidation potential would enable optimisation of hydrometallurgical processing conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: TRANSACTIONS OF THE INDIAN INSTITUTE OF METALS, 51(5), 271-278
